uk.ac.ebi.centres

Interface PriorityRule<A>

  • Type Parameters:
    A -
    All Superinterfaces:
    java.util.Comparator<Ligand<A>>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractPriorityRule, AtomicNumberRule, CombinedRule, DescriptorRule, DuplicateAtomRule, MassNumberRule, PairRule, RSRule, ZERule

    public interface PriorityRule<A>
extends java.util.Comparator<Ligand<A>>
    Defines a comparator for ligands. The default Comparator can be used to prioritise ligands however the compareLigands(Ligand, Ligand) also adds meta data about the type of the descriptor via the Comparison
    Author:
    John May
    See Also:
    Comparison, Comparator

      • prioritise

        Priority prioritise(java.util.List<Ligand<A>> ligands)
        Prioritises ligands using the provided sorter and indicates whether the ligands were unique.
        Parameters:
        ligands - a list of ligands to prioritise
        Returns:
        whether the ligands were unique

      • setSorter

        void setSorter(LigandSorter<A> sorter)
        Allows injection of a ligand sorter. The ligand sort is used when two compared ligands are ranked equally. The sorter needs to be injected for as when combination of priority rules is required the sorting must be done all proceeding rules.
        Parameters:
        sorter - the ligand sorter to use

      • compareLigands

        Comparison compareLigands(Ligand<A> o1,
                          Ligand<A> o2)
        Analogous to Comparator.compare(Object, Object) the prioritise method combines the Descriptor.Type to the order and can indicate what comparison method was used. The single comparison cases the type doesn't change however when using a combined comparator the type may change depending on which comparator was used.
        Parameters:
        o1 - first ligand
        o2 - second ligand
        Returns:
        the order of the two objects
        See Also:
        Comparator.compare(Object, Object)

      • getType

        Descriptor.Type getType()
        Access the descriptor type this rule indicates. Normally rules will indicate. In rare cases a rule produce a pseudo-asymmetric centre.
        Returns:
        the type of rule

      • setHalt

        void setHalt(boolean value)
        Indicates the rule should halt. This allows us to terminate a timed out thread but stopping all comparisons
        Parameters:
        value -
